Utterance: Hi! Welcome back! How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been a mixed bag, honestly. I did some of the things we talked about, but I still feel a bit stuck.
That’s completely okay. Let’s dive into it. What did you manage to accomplish this week?
I wrote down my strengths and sent out a couple more resumes. But I still feel anxious about the whole job search.
That’s great to hear you took those steps! It’s understandable to feel anxious, especially when it’s something so important to you. What specifically is causing that anxiety?
I think it’s just the uncertainty of it all. I keep thinking, “What if I don’t hear back?” or “What if I get rejected again?”
Those are common worries in a job search. Have you noticed how those thoughts affect your mood or motivation?
Yeah, when I think about it too much, I just want to give up. It feels like I’m stuck in this cycle.
Recognizing that cycle is a big step. What do you think you could do to break that cycle when you notice it happening?
Maybe I could take a break from job searching for a bit, do something fun instead?
That sounds like a good idea! Engaging in enjoyable activities can help reset your mindset. What’s something you enjoy doing?
I love watching movies, of course! Maybe I could have a movie night or something.
That sounds perfect! It could be a nice way to unwind. How about your sleep? Have you noticed any changes since we last spoke?
I’ve been trying the deep breathing before bed, and it’s helping a bit, but I still wake up sometimes.
It’s great that you’re trying the breathing exercises. It might take time to see consistent improvements. Have you thought about keeping a sleep journal to track patterns?
No, I haven’t. That could be interesting to see what’s affecting my sleep.
It could be very insightful! You might discover triggers or patterns that you can address. Would you be willing to give that a shot?
Yeah, I can try that.
Wonderful! You mentioned feeling stuck. Have there been any new developments in your job search that might have contributed to that feeling?
Not really. I haven’t heard back from any of the places I applied to, which is frustrating.
That’s understandable. It can feel discouraging when you’re putting in effort but not seeing immediate results. How do you usually cope with that frustration?
I try to distract myself, but sometimes it just lingers.
It’s important to acknowledge those feelings. Would it help to talk about your feelings of frustration in a more constructive way, perhaps through journaling or art?
I think that could be useful. I used to write a lot, but I haven’t done it in a while.
Writing can be a powerful outlet for processing emotions. Would you consider setting aside some time each week to write about your feelings and experiences?
Yes, I think I’ll try that.

Great! As we wrap up today, let’s summarize what you want to focus on for the upcoming week. You’ll continue job searching, enjoy some movie time, practice deep breathing, keep a sleep journal, and start writing again. How does that sound?
That sounds like a solid plan!
I’m excited to hear about your progress next time. Remember, it’s okay to take things one step at a time.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support!
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
Bye!
